visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing comparative wheat export values across top producing nations using value-labeled columns with currency-formatted tooltips
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional categorical-comparative data: 10 country entities (nominal scale) vs. their respective export values in billion USD (ratio scale). Primary data appears sourced from industry reports with precision to two decimal places, showing Russia (μ=6.4B) and US (μ=6.3B) as leaders, with values decaying exponentially through subsequent countries (σ²=3.76B²). The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines and using direct value labels, adhering to Tufte's principles. Cairo's perceptual truthfulness is maintained through proportional column heights and a zero-based y-axis. Color choice (#5997DE) provides sufficient contrast while avoiding chromatic distortion of quantitative relationships. The $1.25B-$6.4B range uses natural data breaks without artificial binning, preserving original measurement precision.
